HW_Parser.php

check() looks for input the module can handle. In this case the module simply watches for the string "HW".

parse() demonstrates a couple options when the correct input is detected. If a transaction is in progress, it displays an error message. Otherwise, it sends the browser to a different display script.

N.B. the HelloWorld display module is just an example; that file does not exist in the gui-modules directory.

00001 <?php
00002 
00003 class HW_Parser extends Parser {
00004 
00005         function check($str){
00006 
00007                 if (strtoupper($str) == "HW")
00008                         return True;
00009 
00010                 return False;
00011                 
00012         }
00013 
00014         function parse($str){
00015                 global $CORE_LOCAL;
00016 
00017                 $return_value = $this->default_json();
00018 
00019                 if ($CORE_LOCAL->get("LastID") != "0"){
00020                         $return_value['output'] = DisplayLib::boxMsg("transaction in progress");
00021                 }
00022                 else {
00023                         $return_value['main_frame'] = MiscLib::base_url().'gui-modules/HelloWorld.php';
00024                 }
00025 
00026                 return $return_value;
00027         }
00028 
00029 }
00030 
00031 ?>
